page.title: 16EDUCATION,CAREW AREA,TENBY.
page.content: { The area is served by a County {Primary Infant and Junior School.}It was built in 1953 to serve a wide catchment area.Pupils are transported from E.Williamston,Broadmoor and Redberth in the east;and Milton and W.Williamston in the West.It is a feeder school to Greenhill Comprehen_ sive,Tenby.A new influx into the area helped numbers increase to 126.The staff include{Headteacher Mr.E.K.Owen {D.Head Mrs.J.Morris,Mrs.P.Stubbs,Miss {B.Wilkins and Mr.J.McInally.}2 mobile classrooms have been added recently. Making ends meet in Education in 1985 is difficult.Savage cuts in capitation allowances have been offset by tremendous financial support by parents and friends,and has allowed the Headmaster to spend more on the school in the past 3 years than the Authority has allocated to the school.
